worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #3333: ARROW-4179: [Python] Use more public API to determine whether a test has a pytest mark or not
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3333
 
 
   There was an internal API change in pytest 4.1.0 that resulted in our pytest configuration logic failing to check if marks were set or not on unit tests. I confirmed that the following fixes the problem both on pytest 4.0.x (where things still worked) and 4.1.0 (when things broke)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Since there have been some conda-forge library updates I would guess this is toolchain-related
fields.summary: [Python] Tests crashing on all platforms in CI

comments.body: Two libraries that changed between a passing build and failing build are pytest (4.0.2 -> 4.1.0) and hypothesis (3.86.4 -> 3.86.5). The C++ toolchain appears unchanged
I merged thrift-cpp 0.12 this morning. Might also be relevant
I thought so, the tests started failing before the merge though, so likely something else
I confirmed that pytest 4.1.0 segfaults on Ubuntu 14.04 but 4.0.2 is fine. I'm going to dig in and see what is going on
For me everything that is marked with {{pytest.mark.*}} is being run although I don't have Gandiva or ORC available.
Patch coming in a minute or two
I'm just starting to investigate, but both nightly packaging builds and tests are failing: https://github.com/kszucs/crossbow/branches/all?query=nightly
